com.game.characters

Class Creature

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.game.characters.GameCharacter
      • com.game.characters.Creature
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Monster, Player

    public abstract class Creature
extends GameCharacter
    Author:
    TBworkstation, Ian

    • Constructor Detail

      • Creature

        public Creature(java.lang.String name,
        GameCharacter.Gender gender,
        java.lang.String anim_directory,
        int baseHP,
        int baseMP,
        int baseSPD,
        int baseSTR,
        int baseINT,
        int baseXP,
        int hpMult,
        int mpMult,
        Weapon baseWeap,
        QuestEvent qe)
        Creates a new creature with a unique ID and name, Also defines gender, the base stats for the Creature, and the inventory
        Parameters:
        ID - integer ID number of the character
        name - a String name of the character, visible to other characters in the world
        gender - the gender of the character
        baseStats - the base Statistics of the character all current statistics will be calculated by this
        inventory - the current inventory of the character

    • Method Detail

      • equipWeapon

        public void equipWeapon(Weapon weapon)
                 throws IllegalInventoryException
        Equips a Weapon to this creature. If the Creature's current Weapon is not null, it removes that Weapon and puts it back into inventory
        Parameters:
        weapon - the Weapon to equipped. The Weapon must be in the characters Loot
        Throws:
        IllegalInventoryException - if the Weapon is not in the characters Loot

      • unequipWeapon

        public Weapon unequipWeapon()
                     throws IllegalInventoryException
        Removes the currently equipped Weapon from the creature. If the creature doesn't have a Weapon equipped, this silently does nothing
        Returns:
        returns the weapon unequipped by the creature
        Throws:
        IllegalInventoryException - if the inventory is full.

      • getCurrentWeapon

        public Weapon getCurrentWeapon()
        Returns the character's current Weapon. If the character has no Weapon equipped, it will return null
        Returns:
        a Weapon the Creature has equipped at the moment null if there is nothing equipped.

      • equipArmor

        public void equipArmor(Armor armor)
                throws IllegalInventoryException
        Equips an armor from the player's inventory. If the Creature's current armor is not null, it removes that Armor and puts it back into inventory. Then the specified armor is equipped
        Parameters:
        armor -
        Throws:
        IllegalInventoryException

      • unequipArmor

        public Armor unequipArmor()
                   throws IllegalInventoryException
        Removes the currently equipped Armor from the creature and puts it back into its Loot inventory. If the creature has no armor equipped, it will silently do nothing and return null
        Returns:
        the Armor the creature is trying to remove
        Throws:
        IllegalInventoryException - the the inventory is full;

      • getArmor

        public Armor getArmor()
        Gets the currently equipped Armor or null if no Armor is currently equipped
        Returns:
        Null or the current Armor equipped by the player

      • getWeapon

        public Weapon getWeapon()
        Gets the current equipped Weapon or null if no Weapon is currently equipped
        Returns:
        null or the current Weapon equipped by the player

      • dropInventory

        public Loot dropInventory()
        Per the system Spec, this will remove ALL Swag and moolah from a player's inventory, EXCEPT for their currently equipped Weapon and Armor.
        Returns:
        the player's inventory contents, including moolah and any Swag

      • getBaseStat

        public int getBaseStat(Creature.Stat stat)
        Returns an integer value of the base statistics of the character
        Parameters:
        stat - the Creature.Stat to be queried
        Returns:
        the base integer value of the stat specified

      • changeStat

        public void changeStat(Creature.Stat stat,
              int amount)
        Changes the player's Creature.Stat by a specified amount. Will not let the Creature.Stat drop below 0. If the Creature.Stat parameter is HEALTHPOINTS or MAGICPOINTS this will not allow the Creature.Stat to go above their maximum.
        Parameters:
        stat - the Creature.Stat to change
        amount - the integer amount to change it by. Can be either negative or positive

      • changeBaseHPorMP

        public void changeBaseHPorMP(Creature.Stat stat,
                    int amount)
        Will only change the base HP or MP of a Creature by the indicated amount. This is mainly used for buffing purposes only. If the Creature.Stat is anything but HEALTHPOINTS or MAGICPOINTS, it will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        stat - Stat.HEALTHPOINTS or Stat.MAGICPOINTS
        amount - the amount the change the stat by

      • getCurrStat

        public int getCurrStat(Creature.Stat stat)
        Returns the value of the current stat specified
        Parameters:
        stat - the Creature.Stat to be queried
        Returns:
        the crrent integer value of the stat specified

      • getCurrStatPart

        public final double getCurrStatPart(Creature.Stat stat)
        Gets the part of a Stat that the cresture currently has.

      • getSpellInventory

        public SpellInventory getSpellInventory()
        Returns the spell inventory of the creature. Allows access to the SpellInventory's add/getSet methods.
        Returns:
        a SpellInventory object belonging to the current creature

      • recovery

        public void recovery()
        A recovery function specified in the system specs on page 15 for monsters this should be specified in the Monster class

      • addToAttackerSet

        public void addToAttackerSet(Creature creature)
        Adds the creature to the creature's attackerSet. This allows each monster to keep track of who attacked it until it recovers fully. After it recovers fully, it will remove all creatures from the set and start over
        Parameters:
        creature - the attacking Creature

      • getAttackerSet

        public java.util.Set<Creature> getAttackerSet()
        Returns a set of the creatures currently attacking this creature. This method will not clear the attackerSet, so if called within the DieCommand, a set.clear() should be called after xp has been distributed;
        Returns:
        the set of all attackers that have damaged this creature

      • setIsFlying

        public void setIsFlying(boolean b)
        Sets the isFlying flag to true or false
        Parameters:
        b - the boolean to set isFlying to

      • isFlying

        public boolean isFlying()
        Returns if the character is flying or not.
        Returns:
        true if the creature is flying, false otherwise

      • getRespawnTime

        public abstract int getRespawnTime()
        Returns the respawn time according to the type of creature it is. If it is a player, it will be shorter than a monster's respawn time
        Returns:
        the respawn time as an integer in game ticks

      • levelHP

        public abstract int levelHP()
        Returns the additional HEALTHPOINTS a creature gets upon level up

      • levelMP

        public abstract int levelMP()
        Returns the additional MAGICPOINTS a creature gets upon level up

      • levelSTR

        public abstract int levelSTR()
        Returns the additional STRENGTH a creature gets upon level up

      • levelSPD

        public abstract int levelSPD()
        Returns the additional SPEED a creature gets upon level up

      • levelINT

        public abstract int levelINT()
        Returns the additional INTELLIGENCE a creature gets upon level up

      • levelXP

        public abstract int levelXP()
        Returns the new target XP for a character

      • getSpellRate

        public abstract int getSpellRate()
        Returns the integer level rate that determines when a character can learn new spells such that LEVEL % SPELL_RATE == 0

      • levelIncreaseHP

        public void levelIncreaseHP(int amount)
        Called ONLY by the LevelPlayerCommand to keep both the server's view of the player and the clients view of the player the same
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to increase its base HEALTHPOINTS by

      • levelIncreaseMP

        public void levelIncreaseMP(int amount)
        Called ONLY by the LevelPlayerCommand to keep both the server's view of the player and the clients view of the player the same
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to increase its base MAGICPOINTS by

      • levelIncreaseSTR

        public void levelIncreaseSTR(int amount)
        Called ONLY by the LevelPlayerCommand to keep both the server's view of the player and the clients view of the player the same
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to increase its base STRENGTH by

      • levelIncreaseINT

        public void levelIncreaseINT(int amount)
        Called ONLY by the LevelPlayerCommand to keep both the server's view of the player and the clients view of the player the same
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to increase its base INTELLIGENCE by

      • levelIncreaseSPD

        public void levelIncreaseSPD(int amount)
        Called ONLY by the LevelPlayerCommand to keep both the server's view of the player and the clients view of the player the same
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to increase its base SPEED by

      • levelSetXP

        public void levelSetXP(int amount)
        Called ONLY by the LevelPlayerCommand to keep both the server's view of the player and the clients view of the player the same
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to set the player's target XP to

      • levelUp

        public void levelUp()
        Increases the players level by one. THIS SHOULD ONLY BE CALLED BY THE LevelPlayerCommand to keep synchronization of the server's player and client's player
